The author himself argues that Shakespeare groups the depth of the human emotions and modern inventions can't change that and the experts agree with him; all of them say that he wrote beautiful plays and sonnets that still understand the faults and interests of our emotions.

By experiencing the past we are confronting the present and discover new aspects and interpretations of Shakespeare's work.

Tobias Wellemeyer, artistic director at the Hans-Otto-Theatre in Potsdam explains as well what was said before but also compliments Shakespeare's characters that were surprising and human and how without him literature wouldn't be where it is now.
